title: Sax Altman Tournament
text: The Sax Altman Tournament was a <a href="golf">golf</a> tournament held in New Zealand in late November 1968. The event was played on the Lochiel course near <a href="Hamilton%2C%20New%20Zealand">Hamilton, New Zealand</a>. It was the first event of the New Zealand's summer golf circuit. The event resulted in a tie between <a href="Peter%20Thomson%20%28golfer%29">Peter Thomson</a> and <a href="Guy%20Wolstenholme">Guy Wolstenholme</a>. <a href="Kel%20Nagle">Kel Nagle</a> finished a stroke behind. Wolstenholme missed a 14-foot putt on the final green that would have given him an outright victory.
